title.narrative: DEMAND FOR EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2023, communities have increased capacity to demand accountability from local providers for inclusive, equitable, relevant and quality education services., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys, particularly the rural and urban poor, have increased access to inclusive, equitable, relevant and quality early childhood and basic education that promotes lifelong learning, including in emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, communities have increased capacity to demand accountability from local providers for inclusive, equitable, relevant andquality education services.

description.narrative: In 2021 this output was mostly focused on addressing the impact of COVID19 on education. ;. Through the Communication for Education (C4E) initiative to increase children’s and parents’ awareness on the importance of returning to school after the school closure due to the COVID19 pandemic, back-to-school campaigns were conducted through multimedia nationwide as well as through community engagement in the six most vulnerable provinces reaching 1,278 schools. During the school closure C4E interventions focused on increasing awareness of the importance of continuous learning among students, teachers and families in vulnerable communities in the same schools and target provinces. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:05/01/2022
